com.snowplow.javaplow

Class PlowContractor<T>

  • Object
    • com.snowplow.javaplow.PlowContractor<T>

  • public class PlowContractor<T>
extends Object
    Contractor Class The contractor class is used to create a standard list of assertions that abide by the snowplow conventions. This ensures that in the following steps of snowplow data processing all information needed will be present. Contractor Class, mostly used to assert preconditions Contractor to verify preconditions, post conditions and invariants. Uses data structure to hold custom ID contracts for specific jobs
    Version:
    0.0.2
    Author:
    Kevin Gleason

      Slight work-around due to lack of lambda functions.

    • Field Detail

      • non_empty_string

        public static final PlowContractor.Function<String> non_empty_string
        Non Empty String Some pieces of the Snowplow enrichment process would be thrown off if certain fields were empty. This function ensured that the string input fits the snowplow standards where required.

      • is_supported_platform

        See Also:

    • Method Detail

      • checkContract

        public boolean checkContract(boolean checkContracts,
                    PlowContractor.Function<T> function,
                    T input)
        Contract Checker Checks the preconditions and post conditions depending on how it is configured Can be enabled or disabled as needed with first argument which will be passed by the Tracker instance.
        Parameters:
        checkContracts - boolean function passed from Tracker instance, if false contracts are turned off and all checks return true.
        function - The name of the function to check. Currently three are implemented and custom functions are allowed.
        input - The input for the function being called and checked if it abides by the contract.
        Returns:
        True or False depending on whether or not the input abides by the rules of the contract.

      • customContract

        public void customContract(String name,
                  PlowContractor.Function<T> function)
        Make a custom contract --Future Make an implementation of the Function interface and pass it in to the custom contract input. This will put it in a Map which can be looked up with checkCustomContract
        Parameters:
        name - Custom name ID of the contract.
        function - The implementation of the Function interface.

      • checkCustomContract

        public boolean checkCustomContract(boolean checkContracts,
                          String name,
                          T input)
        Used to check a custom contract made using the customContract function.
        Parameters:
        checkContracts - Passed in value from TrackerC, if false then checkCustom will always return true
        name - The custom ID of your contract.
        input - The input to be checked using the contract.
        Returns:

      • main

        public static void main(String[] args)
